alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Jones; Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 11 at 7:18PM CDT until September 11 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR HASKELL...NORTHEASTERN JONES...NORTHWESTERN SHACKELFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN THROCKMORTON COUNTIES... At 716 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lake Stamford Marina to Stamford, moving southeast at 30 mph. A second severe thunderstorm had developed 5 miles northeast of Lueders and was moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Lueders and Nugent around 735 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Jud, Big Country Baptist Assembly, The Intersection Of Us- 283 And Ranch Road 209, The Intersection Of Us- 180 And Farm Road 600, Tuxedo and Us-380 Near The Haskell- Stonewall County Line. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Stamford, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
